Crimes.Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness and reasonableness of work permit refusal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Submitted documents showing ties to India
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate strong ties to home country
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Visa officers must provide adequate reasons; no duty to interview if information is complete

Key_Evidence_Considered: Documents on personal and professional ties to India
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged adequacy of reasons and procedural fairness
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Certification of question and overturning of refusal

Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient ties to home country raising risk of overstaying

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness, adequacy of reasons, and reasonableness of refusal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant’s weak personal and professional roots in India
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of ties to home country

Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Strength of ties to home country

Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Officer relied solely on submitted documents

Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of explicit mention of all evidence
